newsitem.title: UK: UK stocks start higher after Wall Street advance.
newsitem.headline: UK stocks start higher after Wall Street advance.

text.p: UK shares inched ahead on Thursday, with investors cheered by Wall Street's strong gains overnight but early trading volume was light as uncertainty remained about the Dow's near-term fortunes.
"The Dow's raging bull may be back on track," the head of trading at a large investment bank said.
"People will be pretty confident now -- until Wall Street falls again."
The FTSE 100 index was up 15.8 points to 4,223.3 by 0835 GMT. The Dow industrials average, which had fallen the previous five sessions, closed 84.66 points higher at 6,740.74.
